answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some links that might help as a start.
Here are the Training Requirements in OSHA Standards and Training Guidelines.
http://www.osha.gov/Publications/2254.html
I have included the Los Angeles Department of Public Works New Employee Orientation Manual which discusses the type of training and employment screening the city uses.
http://bpw.lacity.org/MES/NEO%20Manual.pdf
I also found a Public Works Maintenance Worker job description from Florence, AZ. It has section on minimum qualifications to hire. 
http://www.azleague.org/jobs_attach/florence_pw_maint_wrkr1.pdf
South Orange, NJ Department of Public Works Employment Application is listed below and it includes pre-employment information and requirements. 
http://www.southorange.org/forms/employment/employ_appDPW.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Gaylene Rhoden
text: We will soon be advertising for a Public Works crew member. In order to make sure we have the right candidate, we are considering doing a field or skills test. The test would cover things we would expect somebody to know the first day on the job.  The position would be responsible for roads, snowplowing, parks maintenance, etc. Water and Sewer would not be included. Has anybody done this recently; and, if so, could you share your testing requirements?
title: Testing for Public Works Employees
